summary: This document consists of multiple 30-minute inmate check sheets from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, dated July 18, 2019. The sheets are for tiers ZB, ZA, and others, documenting staff checks on inmates in locked-down status, following a protocol requiring observation at least twice per hour. The document is significant as it represents the type of routine monitoring in place at the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held prior to his death.

events.title: Routine Inmate Monitoring at MCC SHU
events.description: Staff at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, Special Housing Unit conduct and document 30-minute checks on inmates in continuous locked-down status, such as administrative detention or disciplinary segregation.

keyFacts: The document is a set of prison log sheets from the MCC New York Special Housing Unit dated July 18, 2019.
It details a strict protocol requiring staff to observe inmates in locked-down status at least twice per hour, on an irregular schedule.
The sheets are for multiple tiers (e.g., ZB, ZA, -G, -11, -J, -K, L, M), indicating a multi-cell housing unit.
The document is a standard operational record, not mentioning any specific inmates or incidents by name.
The date (July 18, 2019) is shortly before Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody at the same facility on August 10, 2019.
